Food redistribution/free food projects in Nottingham

Last Modified: 11 Dec 2024

  • Himmah Food Bank Himmah operate the largest independent food bank in Nottingham, offer hot meals every week, distribute school uniforms to low-income families, and campaign to eradicate disproportionality in stop and searches, among other crucial initiatives.
  • Foodprint Social supermarket supplied by food distribution partners. Food is redistributed to those experiencing food poverty in Nottingham, via Foodprint's network of community-eating cafes, food banks, and school breakfast clubs, or directly through their brick-and-mortar shop in Sneinton Market. They make good food accessible and affordable to everyone who needs it.
  • NottsHelpYourself Food Support Free groups offering food, and downloadable resources for recipes and kitchen skills.
  • FareShare East Midlands Midlands charity who distribute large volumes of surplus food to charities and community groups.
  • Emmanuel House Meal services Emmanuel House are a Nottingham City-based charity who provide hot meals and other free welfare and legal services to people who are homeless and/or don't have access to public funds.
